text:
When i tryed to start up the sever this morning i got this:

[Wed Jul 03 08:39:38 2002] [emerg] (28)No space left on device: Couldn't create 
accept lock

There is over 1200 MB free on that partion.
creator: srashmo@sandia.gov

text:
Unfortunately, "ENOSPC - No space left on device" is the way that
some SysV semaphore creation failures are reported on Unix.
Presumably there are no free semaphore sets available.

You can use the ipcs command to see if you have semaphores left around
that aren't being used.  The ipcrm command can be used to remove them.

You may wish to add "AcceptMutex fcntl" to your config file if you want to
avoid these issues with SysV semaphores.

Thanks for using Apache!
creator: trawick@apache.org
